Sentence: Mary guesses right away that Jay is dead, and Andrew confirms this fact
He (Andrew) says that a cotter pin fell out of the steering mechanism of Jay's car, and that when he (Jay) hit a rock in the road he (Jay) lost control
Andrew calls Ralph to alert Jay's side of the family about the death

It occurs to Mary that Jay may have been drunk when he (Jay) crashed the car; she (Mary) immediately tells herself, however, that Andrew would have told her (Mary) if that was even a possibility, and she (Mary) puts the thought out of her (Mary) head
Then Andrew gets angry with Father Jackson and tells Rufus that the priest refused to read the full burial service because Jay had never been baptized
